summary: The Land And National Defense Act, or the LAND Act, aims to restrict foreign purchases of U.S. agricultural land. It mandates that foreign purchasers face the same limitations as U.S. citizens in their home countries and adhere to state laws. The bill defines foreign purchasers and establishes a Task Force to identify violations, track land sales, and report to Congress on land sales to foreign purchasers, including location, cost, and proximity to military installations. The Secretary of Agriculture must also notify the appropriate members of Congress of such sales. The bill includes severability and definitions.
